com.inamik.template
Class TemplateEngine

java.lang.Object
  com.inamik.template.TemplateEngine

public abstract class TemplateEngine
extends java.lang.Object

TemplateEngine - A factory capable of generating templates and macros.

When applicable, the template engine will cache for faster retrieval and execution.

Created on Jul 27, 2006

Author:
Dave
See Also:
TemplateEngineConfig, Template, TemplateMacro

Method Detail

getInstance

public static TemplateEngine getInstance()
                                  throws TemplateException
getInstance - Factory method to return a singleton TemplateEngine, or create one with the default configuration if a singletone has not already been created.

This method is kept for compability and is equivelent to:

   TemplateEngine.getDefaultInstance()

Returns:
The default TemplateEngine
Throws:
TemplateException
See Also:
getDefaultInstance(), TemplateConfigUtil, TemplateConfigUtil.DEFAULT_ENGINE_CONFIG, TemplateEngineConfig

getInstance

public static TemplateEngine getInstance(java.lang.String filename)
                                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                         TemplateException
getInstance w/String - Factory method to create a TemplateEngine from a file.

The specified file must conform to the layout described in the file 'inamik_template_lib-sample.xml'.

This is a convenience method and is equivelent to:

   TemplateEngine.getInstance(TemplateConfigUtil.readTemplateEngineConfig(filename))

Parameters:
filename - The configuration file to load
Returns:
A TemplateEngine based on the specified configuration.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
TemplateException
java.lang.NullPointerException - If filename == null.
See Also:
TemplateConfigUtil

getInstance

public static TemplateEngine getInstance(TemplateEngineConfig engineConfig)
                                  throws TemplateException
getInstance w/TemplateEngineConfig - Factory method to create a TemplateEngine from a TemplateEngineConfig instance.

This allows you to create TemplateEngine instances without having to create a configuration file.

This method makes a defensive copy of the supplied TemplateEngineConfig and is guaranteed not to modify the caller's copy.

Parameters:
engineConfig - The configuration use
Returns:
A TemplateEngine based on the specified configuration.
Throws:
TemplateException
java.lang.NullPointerException - If engineConfig == null
See Also:
TemplateEngineConfig

getDefaultInstance

public static TemplateEngine getDefaultInstance()
                                         throws TemplateException
getDefaultInstance - Factory method to return a singleton TemplateEngine, or create one with the default configuration if a singletone has not already been created.

To create a default configuration, first it looks for DEFAULT_ENGINE_CONFIG in the current directory. If it does not find it there, then it looks for it on the classpath. If it still cannot find the file, then it uses the default values for TemplateEngineConfig.

Returns:
The default TemplateEngine
Throws:
TemplateException
See Also:
TemplateConfigUtil, TemplateConfigUtil.DEFAULT_ENGINE_CONFIG, TemplateEngineConfig

getDefaultInstance

public static TemplateEngine getDefaultInstance(java.io.File file)
                                         throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                                TemplateException
getDefaultInstance w/File - Factory method to create a singleton TemplateEngine from a java.io.File.

The specified file must conform to the layout described in the file 'inamik_template_lib-sample.xml'

This method will throw an IllegalStateException if a singleton TemplateEngine already exists, regardless of how the singleton was created.

This is a convenience method and is equivelent to:

   TemplateEngine.getDefaultInstance(TemplateConfigUtil.readTemplateEngineConfig(file))

Parameters:
file - The configuration file to load
Returns:
A TemplateEngine based on the specified configuration.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException
TemplateException
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if a singleton TemplateEngine already exists
java.lang.NullPointerException - If file == null.
See Also:
TemplateConfigUtil

This allows you to create TemplateEngine instances without having to create a configuration file.

This method will throw an IllegalStateException if a singleton TemplateEngine alredy exists, regardless of how the singleton was created.

This method makes a defensive copy of the supplied TemplateEngineConfig and is guaranteed not to modify the caller's copy.

setTemplateRoot

public void setTemplateRoot(java.lang.String templateRoot)
                     throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                            java.io.IOException
setTemplateRoot - A convenience method for setting the templateRoot.

This method is most useful when using a TemplateEngine without a configuration file. With this method, you can have a usable TemplateEngine in just two lines of code

TemplateEngine templateEngine = TemplateEngine.getInstance();
templateEngine.setTemplateRoot("/templates");

Verifies that the templateRoot exists and is a directory

Parameters:
templateRoot - The template root folder. null is okay and indicates that you want the template root folder to be the same as the application root folder.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - If templateRoot does not exist or is not a directory.
java.io.IOException
See Also:
TemplateEngineConfig.setTemplateRoot(String)
